At intersections, crosswalks, and railro: Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming.
A large truck is ahead of you and is tur: May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
A police officer is signaling you to dri: Jailed in the country jail for not more than one year
A school bus ahead of you in your lane i: Stop as long as the red lights are flashing
A solid yellow line next to a broken yel: Next to the broken line may pass.
A U-turn is not permitted:: On or near any curve or hill.
A white painted curb indicates a:: Loading zone for passengers or mail only
After passing a car, it is safe to retur: You can see both headlights of the car you just passed in your rearview mirror
All of the following practices are dange: Listening to music through headphones that cover both ears.
Always stop before you cross railroad tr: You don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
Another car creates a hazardous situatio: Take your foot off the gas
At a four way stop, if two vehicles are: both vehicles can go at the same time.
At a four way stop, the first vehicle to: should be the first to leave
At a four way stop, when two vehicles re: the driver of the vehicle on left must yield to the driver of the vehicle on the right
At a red traffic light with a green arro: You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
At an intersection controlled by a \"STO: you must come to a complete stop and check for pedestrians and cross traffic. Yield to other traffic going through the intersection and any pedestrians crossing the street.
At intersections where two or more drive: the driver on the left must yield the right-of-way to the driver on the right.
Define blind intersection: an intersection in which your view of traffic on an intersecting road is impeded
California's \"Basic Speed Law\" says yo: Never drive faster than is safe for current conditions
California's \"Basic Speed Law\" states: You should not drive faster than is safe given the weather and vehicle conditions
Define this sign: Cross Road: One of the intersection traffic signs. Another road crosses the highway ahead. Look left and right for other traffic. Be alert for cross-traffic and regulatory signals.
Define this sign: Divided Highway Begins: The highway ahead is split into two separate roadways by a median or divider and each roadway is one-way. Keep to the right.
Define this sign: Divided Highway Ends: The divided highway on which you are traveling ends 350 to 500 feet ahead. You will then be on a roadway with two-way traffic. Keep to the right of approaching traffic.
Define this sign: DO NOT ENTER sign: is usually installed at the beginning of one-way streets and ramps and it prohibits drivers from entering a one-way roadway where traffic is moving in the opposite direction. A DO NOT ENTER traffic sign is usually installed together with the "WRONG WAY" sign.
During the first 12 months as a newly li: Transport minors between the hours of 11:00 PM and 5:00 A.M
Flash your brake lights or turn on your: Need to warn other drivers of an accident ahead
Define this sign: Four Way Stop: This road sign is placed at four-way stop intersections and informs drivers that all entrances to this intersection are controlled by stop signs.
Freeway lanes that are ending will usual: large broken lines painted on the pavement. If you are driving in a lane marked with these broken lines, be prepared to exit the freeway or for the lane to end.
Generally speaking, you are in a large t: Cannot see the truck driver in the truck's side mirrors
Define this sign: Guide signs: These signs are square or rectangular shaped and are blue, green, or brown with white lettering. They tell drivers what services are available in the area.
Highway pavement will be particularly tr: If it has just begun to rain
How does a solid red traffic light diffe: You are not allowed to turn on a red arrow after stopping
If the roadway is wet and your vehicles: Slowly ease your foot off the gas pedal
If you are being followed too closely on: Reduce your speed slowly to encourage the tailgater to drive around you
If you are convicted of driving under th: Serve up to six months in jail
If you are driving on a highway next to: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes
If you are involved in a traffic collisi: If there is property damage in excess of $1,000 or if there are any injuries.
If you arrive at an intersection when th: Come to a complete stop and proceed when it is safe to do so
If you drive faster than other vehicles: Increase your chances of an accident.
If you have a green light, but traffic i: Stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.
If you miss your exit on the freeway, yo: Back up on the road or shoulder.
If you plan to pass another vehicle, you: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane
If you want to pass a bicyclist riding o: Must sound your horn before passing the bicyclist
If you want to pass a bicyclists riding: You must not squeeze pass the bicyclist
If your vehicle starts to lose traction: Slow down gradually and not apply the breaks
If your wheels drop off the roadway or p: Wait until it is safe to do so, then gradually re-enter the roadway
In which of the following scenarios shou: When parked on a hill or sloping driveway
Why do you increase your following dista: To better see around the sides of the vehicle.
Kaitlyn's Law, California Vehicle Code s: prohibits anyone from leaving a child six years of age or younger unattended in a motor vehicle without the supervision of someone at least 12 years of age or older.
Define this sign: Lane Ends Ahead: Lane ends ahead. This sign is used on multi-lane highways to warn you of a reduction in the number of traffic lanes in the direction you are traveling. Be prepared to change lanes or to allow other vehicles to merge into your lane.
Define this sign: Lane ends, merge left: two lanes of cars will soon become one lane of cars. The right lane must merge to the left yielding to traffic driving in the left lane.
Large trucks turning right onto a street: Often have to use a portion of left lane to complete the turn
Define this sign: Left Curve sign: The roadway ahead curves to the left. Slow your speed and keep well to the right.
Making a U-turn in residential districts: When there are no vehicles approaching
Define this sign: Merging Traffic: Merging traffic. Traffic may be merging into your lane from another roadway. Be ready to either changes lanes or allow other traffic to merge into your lane.
Define this sign: no right turn: Right turns are illegal. Do not make a right turn when you see this sign.
Define this sign: No U-Turn: U-turns are illegal. Do not make a U-turn when you see this sign.
On a green arrow, you must:: Go but, Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection
On rainy, snowy, or foggy days, you shou: Use your headlights so other drivers can see you
Define this sign: Pedestrian Crossing: Watch for people crossing the street. Slow down or stop if necessary. Remember that people crossing the street on the pedestrian crossing have the right of way. Slowing down is important since pedestrians may be obscured by parked vehicles and you may not see them the moment they enter the roadway.
Define this light: Red arrow: A red arrow means STOP. Remain stopped until the green signal or green arrow appears. Do not turn against a red arrow."
Define this light: Red signal light: STOP. A right turn can be made on a red light only after you stop and yield to pedestrians and vehicles in your path. Do not turn in there is a sign prohibiting it. You may turn left on a red light from a one-way street to another one-way street if there is no sign prohibiting it.
Define this sign: Right Curve sign: The roadway ahead curves to the right. Slow your speed and keep well to the left.
Roads are the most slippery:: During the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.
Define this sign: School Crossing Ahead: Signs may display horizontal lines indicating the point where a crosswalk exists. School zone crosswalk traffic signs may have a separate downward-pointing arrow plaque, which indicates the actual location of the crosswalk.
Define this sign: school zone sign: Five-sided sign back on yellow is used only to warn of schools and school crossings. Slow down - school zones have a speed limit you must observe. Watch out for children crossing the street or playing.
Define this sign: Sharp Left Turn: The road will make a sharp turn to the left. Slow your speed, keep to the left and do not pass other vehicles.
Define this sign: Sharp Right Turn: The road will make a sharp turn to the right. Slow your speed, keep to the right, and do not pass other vehicles.
Should you always drive slower than othe: No, you can block traffic when you drive too slowly.
Define this sign: Slippery When Wet: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed. Do not brake hard or change direction suddenly. Increase the distance between your car and the one ahead of you.
Smoking inside a vehicle with a person y: Illegal at all times. In California, it is illegal to smoke in a vehicle at any time when a minor is present.
Define this sign: Stop: A red-and-white regulatory traffic sign. This is the only octagonal (8-sided) traffic sign, you can easily recognize it by both shape and color.
The safest precaution that you can take: Use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.
There is no crosswalk and you see a pede: Stop and let him/her finish crossing the street.
What is the three second rule: is a way to measure the distance that you should use as a cushion when following another vehicle. It requires leaving three seconds of space between your vehicle and the vehicle driving in front of you.
To make a right turn onto a two-way stre: The lane closest to the curb
To turn left from a multilane one-way st: The lane closest to the left curb
To turn left from one-way street onto a: The lane closest to the left curb
Define this sign: Traffic Signal Ahead: This sign warns of traffic signals at the intersection ahead. Slow down; poor visibility is likely and be prepared to come to a complete stop on a red signal.
Two sets of solid double yellow lines sp: May not be crossed for any reason, they are considered a barrier. Do not drive on or over this barrier, make a left turn, or make a U-turn across it, except at designated openings.
Two sets of solid, double, yellow lines: May not be crossed for any reason.
Two vehicles approach an uncontrolled \": The vehicle on the through road
Define this sign: Two-Way Traffic Ahead: Two way traffic ahead. You are leaving a separated one-way roadway and entering a two-way roadway. Also used to remind drivers they are on a two-way road.
U-turns in business districts are:: Legal at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them
What is a three-point turn?: The three-point turn is a way of turning a vehicle around in a small space by going forward, turning to one side, then backing up, turning in order to face the other direction, then going forward again. This type of turn is usually done when the road is too narrow for a U-turn.
What is the first thing to do when you m: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop. You should first signal and pull over to the right side of the road. Stay on the side of the road until traffic is clear and you have plenty of room in both directions to perform the 3-point turn. But just as importantly, you start from the far right side of the road to get as much use of the road as possible as you maneuver your vehicle.
What is the first thing you should do if: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently
When a school bus flashes yellow lights:: The bus is preparing to stop to let the children off the bust
When being followed by a tailgater, whic: When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.
When can you drive in a bike lane?: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.
When changing lanes, you can check your: Using the inside rearview mirror. Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
When driving a car equipped with airbags: Maintain a space of at least 10 inches between you and the steering wheel
When driving at night on a dimly lit str: Drive slowly enough so you can stop within the area lighted by your headlights
When entering traffic after being parked: Should wait for a large enough gap to get up to the speed of the traffic
When parking on a public road, drivers s: Move as far away from traffic as possible.
When parking uphill on a two-way street: Turned to the right (away from the street)
How far should your wheels be when parki: Your wheels must be within 18 inches of the curb.
When passing another vehicle, it is safe: See the vehicle's headlights in your rearview mirror.
When should you turn on your headlights?: 1/2 hour after sunset and 1/2 hour before sunrise.
When you are merging onto the freeway, y: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway.
When you prepare to make a left turn fro: Approach the turn in the left lane of from the left side of a single lane
When you tailgate other drivers (drive c: You can frustrate the other drivers and make them angry.
Which lane must you be in before making: The lane nearest the left curb
Which of the following is true about the: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation and It prevents skidding
What is true when you are moving in a de: All oncoming vehicles and pedestrians are stopped by red lights
What is true about blind spots?: Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
What is true about children riding in yo: Children under the age of 1 should not ride in the front seat in vehicles equipped with airbags
Which of these vehicles must always stop: Tanks trucks marked with hazardous materials placards
Define this sign: Winding Road: (SET OF CURVES). This sign indicates there are three (3) or more curves in a row on the road ahead. The sign is frequently accompanied by an advisory speed sign. Slow down to recommended speed before you enter the curves.
With a Class C drivers license a person: A 3-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds
Define this sign: WRONG WAY sign: You are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp or highway. Do not drive past this sign. Turn around immediately.
Define this sign: YIELD right of way sig: Triangle signs mean yield. You must slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary.
You are approaching an intersection wher: Stop before entering the intersection and proceed when it is safe to do so
You are driving on a one-way street. You: Traffic on the street moves to the left.
You are driving on a roadway where vehic: A middle course between the oncoming traffic and the parked cars
You are driving on the freeway. The vehi: Farther behind the truck than you would for a passenger vehicle.
You are entering a roundabout with multi: Choose the left-land lane and exit
You are getting ready to make a right tu: Slow down or stop, if necessary, and then make the turn.
You are planning to make a left turn fro: Be prepared to obey the next signal that appears
You are preparing to exit the interstate: Immediately upon entering the deceleration lane
You drive defensively when you:: Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards
You have been involved in a minor traffi: Leave a note on the vehicle or Report the collision without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the California highway patrol.
You may cross a double yellow line to pa: Your side of the road is a broken line.
You may not park your vehicle:: Next to a red painted curb
You may turn left onto a one-way street: there is no sign prohibiting the turn.
You must leave an additional \"mattress\: When following a driver whose rear vision is obstructed
You must yield the right-of-way to an em: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.
You see a flashing yellow traffic signal: Slow down and cross the intersection carefully.
You should always travel:: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.
You should not use your horn:: Near blind pedestrians: When driving near a blind pedestrian, using your horn may be dangerous. Yield to the pedestrian and proceed when it is safe to do so.
You were parked and have been waiting a: Continue waiting and yielding to traffic in the lane
Your blood alcohol content (BAC) depends: How much alcohol you drink, how much time passes between drinks, and your weight.
